zone.line: a
And through their lulling plumes uprise
A Shape, a throng of sounds:
May it be, no ill to thee
O thou of many wounds
Near whom for our sweet sister's sake
Ever thus we watch & wake
Panthea
The sound is of whirlwind underground
Earthquake & fire & mountains cloven,
The Shape is awful like the sound,
Clothed in dark purple star-inwoven
pale
A sceptre of proud gold
To stay steps proud, oer the slow cloud
Its His veined hand doth hold
it
Cruel he looks but calm & strong
Like one who does, not suffers wrong
Phantasm
Why have the secret powers of this strange world
Driven me, a frail & empty phantom hither
On direst storms? What unaccustomed sounds
